sentences.text: Dear Shareholders:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are cordially invited to attend the Starbucks Corporation 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders on March 22, 2017 at 10:00 a.m. (Pacific Time) (the Annual Meeting or the Annual Meeting of Shareholders).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The meeting will be held at Marion Oliver McCaw Hall at the Seattle Center, located at 321 Mercer Street, in Seattle, Washington.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: More information appears on the back cover of this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As in prior years, we have elected to deliver our proxy materials to the majority of our shareholders over the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This delivery process allows us to provide shareholders with the information they need, while at the same time conserving natural resources and lowering the cost of delivery.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On January 27, 2017, we mailed to our shareholders a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials (the Notice) containing instructions on how to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Access our proxy statement for our Annual Meeting and our fiscal 2016 Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended October 2, 2016, as filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission (the Annual Report);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vote by Internet, by telephone or by mail; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Receive a paper copy of the proxy materials by mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On January 27, 2017, we also first mailed this proxy statement and the enclosed proxy card to certain shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proof of share ownership will be required to enter the Starbucks Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, each attendee must present a government-issued photo identification (such as a drivers license or passport).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See the back cover of this proxy statement  ADMISSION REQUIREMENTS AND TRANSPORTATION INFORMATION FOR THE STARBUCKS CORPORATION 2017 ANNUAL MEETING OF SHAREHOLDERS for details.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The matters to be acted upon are described in the notice of Annual Meeting of Shareholders and proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the Annual Meeting of Shareholders, we will also report on our operations and respond to questions from shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As always, we anticipate a large number of attendees at the Annual Meeting of Shareholders and cannot guarantee seating for all shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Seating in Marion Oliver McCaw Hall and the adjacent Exhibition Hall is on a first-come, first served basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Doors will open at 8:00 a.m. (Pacific Time) on the day of the event.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will also provide a live webcast of the meeting from the Investor Relations website at http://investor.starbucks.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Presentations and a replay of the webcast will be available on the Investor Relations site under Webcasts & Presentations after the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We hope this provides those unable to attend the meeting the opportunity to hear Starbucks leaders discuss our operating results and plans for the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Investor Relations site is frequently updated, and includes additional information we believe our investors find useful.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please also note that Starbucks is committed to providing an accessible experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The event will be interpreted in American Sign Language and real-time captioning will be provided in the auditorium.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Complimentary assistive listening devices and wheelchairs will be available.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: McCaw Hall is an accessible building with wheelchair seating, disability parking and accessible restrooms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you have a disability accommodation request, please call us at (206) 318-7118 or email investorrelations@starbucks.com by March 1, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Alternate formats of this proxy statement, the Annual Report and Letter to Shareholders are available upon request by contacting investorrelations@starbucks.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: YOUR VOTE IS VERY IMPORTANT.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether or not you plan to attend the Annual Meeting, we urge you to please cast your vote as soon as possible by Internet, telephone or mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We look forward to seeing you at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Warm regards,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Howard Schultz chairman and chief executive officer

sentences.text: NOTICE OF ANNUAL MEETING OF SHAREHOLDERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Annual Meeting of Shareholders of Starbucks Corporation will be held at Marion Oliver McCaw Hall at the Seattle Center, located at 321 Mercer Street, in Seattle, Washington, on March 22, 2017 at 10:00 a.m. (Pacific Time) for the following purposes:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. To elect fourteen directors nominated by the board of directors to serve until the 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareholders;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. To approve an advisory resolution on our executive compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. To conduct an advisory vote on the frequency of future advisory votes on executive compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. To ratify the selection of Deloitte & Touche LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for the fiscal year ending October 1, 2017;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5. To consider a shareholder proposal described in the accompanying proxy statement, if properly presented at the Annual Meeting of Shareholders; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6. To transact such other business as may properly come before the Annual Meeting of Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Only shareholders of record at the close of business on January 12, 2017 will be entitled to notice of, and to vote at, the Annual Meeting of Shareholders and any adjournments or postponements thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: YOUR VOTE IS VERY IMPORTANT.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether or not you plan to attend the Annual Meeting, we urge you to cast your vote and submit your proxy in advance of the meeting by one of the methods below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Make sure to have your proxy card or voting instruction form (VIF) in hand.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. By Internet: go to www.proxyvote.com;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. By toll-free telephone: call 1-800-690-6903; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. By mail (if you received a paper copy of the proxy materials by mail): mark, sign, date and promptly mail the enclosed proxy card in the postage-paid envelope.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Submitting your proxy now will not prevent you from voting your shares at the meeting, as your proxy is revocable at your option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders may also vote in person at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a registered shareholder (that is, you hold your shares in your name), you must present valid identification to vote at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a beneficial shareholder (that is, your shares are held in the name of a broker, bank or other holder of record), you will also need to obtain a legal proxy from the registered shareholder to vote at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FINANCIAL HIGHLIGHTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Starbucks record fiscal 2016 results in the face of ongoing economic, consumer and geopolitical headwinds demonstrate the power, relevance and resilience of the Starbucks business and brand.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company delivered record results in its 53-week fiscal year 2016, increasing global comparable store sales by 5% driven by a 4% increase in ticket and a 1% increase in traffic, consolidated net revenue grew 11% to $21.3 billion and consolidated operating income grew by 16% to $4.2 billion year over year; 3-year cumulative total shareholder return (TSR) was 46%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we returned $3.2 billion to shareholders in the form of share repurchases and cash dividend payments in fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION HIGHLIGHTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program is designed to achieve the following key objectives:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay for performance through aligning compensation with the achievement of both short-term and long-term financial objectives that build shareholder value; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Enable the attraction and retention of top talent by
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: competing effectively for the highest quality people who will shape our long-term success;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Be true to our values by supporting our mission statement and guiding principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Some of the compensation best practices we employ to achieve these objectives include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What We Do What We Dont Do  Deliver a majority of executives target total direct compensation in the form of variable, at-risk, performance-based compensation  Have single-trigger change-in-control equity acceleration provisions  Utilize performance-based RSUs with vesting requirements  Provide cash-based change-in-control benefits  Require our executives and directors to satisfy rigorous stock ownership guidelines  Provide excise tax gross-ups of perquisites  Maintain a clawback policy  Provide significant perquisites  Prohibit Starbucks partners (employees) from engaging in hedging transactions in Starbucks stock or pledging Starbucks stock  Maintain a supplemental executive retirement plan (SERP)  Conduct annual say-on-pay advisory votes
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fiscal years 2015 and 2014 each included 52 weeks.

sentences.text: We are making this proxy statement available to you on January 27, 2017 in connection with the solicitation of proxies by our board of directors for the Starbucks Corporation 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At Starbucks and in this proxy statement, we refer to our employees as partners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also in this proxy statement, we sometimes refer to Starbucks as the Company, we or us, and to the 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders as the 2017 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Record Date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The record date for the Annual Meeting is January 12, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On the record date, there were 1,457,306,678 shares of our common stock outstanding and there were no outstanding shares of any other class of stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vote Required.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The presence, in person or by proxy, of holders of a majority of the outstanding shares of Starbucks common stock is required to constitute a quorum for the transaction of business at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions and broker non-votes (shares held by a broker or nominee that does not have discretionary authority to vote on a particular matter and has not received voting instructions from its client) are counted for purposes of determining the presence or absence of a quorum for the transaction of business at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting Your Proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Holders of shares of common stock are entitled to cast one vote per share on all matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxies will be voted as instructed by the shareholder or shareholders granting the proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless contrary instructions are specified, if the proxy is completed and submitted (and not revoked) prior to the Annual Meeting, the shares of Starbucks common stock represented by the proxy will be voted:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) FOR the election of each of the fourteen director candidates nominated by the board of directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) FOR approval of the advisory resolution on our executive compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) to conduct future advisory votes on executive compensation EVERY YEAR;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) FOR ratification of the selection of Deloitte & Touche LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for the fiscal year ending October 1, 2017 (fiscal 2017);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) AGAINST the shareholder proposal regarding amendment to the Companys proxy access bylaw; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) in accordance with the best judgment of the named proxies on any other matters properly brought before the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have majority voting procedures for the election of directors in uncontested elections.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a quorum is present, a nominee for election to a position on the board of directors will be elected as a director if the votes cast for the nominee exceed the votes cast against the nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The term of any incumbent director who does not receive a majority of votes cast in an election held under the majority voting standard terminates on the earliest to occur of:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) 90 days from the date on which the voting results of the election are certified;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the date the board of directors fills the position; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) the date the director resigns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a quorum is present, approval of the advisory resolution on executive compensation, the results of the frequency of future advisory votes on executive compensation, ratification of the selection of Deloitte & Touche LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm and approval of the shareholder proposal, and any other matters that properly come before the meeting, require that the votes cast in favor of such actions exceed the votes cast opposing such actions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following will not be considered votes cast and will not count in determining the election of any director nominee or approval of the other proposals:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) broker non-votes;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) a share whose ballot is marked as abstain; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) a share otherwise present at the Annual Meeting but for which there is an abstention; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) a share otherwise present at the Annual Meeting but which is not voted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Revoking Your Proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a registered shareholder (meaning, a shareholder who holds shares issued in his or her name and therefore appears on the share register) and have executed a proxy, you may revoke or change your proxy at any time before it is exercised by:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) executing and delivering a later-dated proxy card to our corporate secretary prior to the Annual Meeting;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) delivering written notice of revocation of the proxy to our corporate secretary prior to the Annual Meeting; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) attending and voting in person at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attendance at the Annual Meeting, in and of itself, will not constitute a revocation of a proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you voted by telephone or the Internet and wish to change your vote, you may call the toll-free number or go to the website, as may be applicable in the case of your earlier vote, and follow the directions for revoking or changing your vote.

sentences.text: Starbucks Corporation 2017 Proxy Statement 7
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 1  ELECTION OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our board of directors currently has twelve members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with the Companys Amended and Restated Bylaws, the board increased the size of the board to fourteen members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: James G. Shennan, Jr. will retire from the board of directors immediately prior to the 2017 Annual Meeting in accordance with our Corporate Governance Principles and Practices mandatory retirement age requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board of directors has nominated all of the remaining eleven directors and three additional persons, Rosalind Brewer, Jrgen Vig Knudstorp and Satya Nadella, for election at the 2017 Annual Meeting, to serve until the 2018 Annual Meeting of shareholders and until their respective successors have been elected and qualified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the current directors were elected at the 2016 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Brewer and Mr. Nadella were first identified as possible director candidates by a third-party search firm and then recommended to the board for nomination by the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee (Nominating/Governance Committee).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Knudstorp was first identified as a possible director candidate by a non-management director and then recommended to the board for nomination by the Nominating/Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Food and beverage industry experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As the premier roaster, marketer and retailer of specialty coffee in the world, we seek directors who have knowledge of and experience in the food and beverage industry, which is useful in understanding our product development and retail and licensing operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consumer products and foodservice experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We seek directors with expertise in consumer products and foodservice as we continue to increase our focus on expanding our Channel Development business on a global scale.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Brand marketing experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Brand marketing experience is important for our directors to have because of the importance of image and reputation in the specialty coffee business and our objective to maintain Starbucks standing as one of the most recognized and respected brands in the world.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: International operations and distribution experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Starbucks has a strong global presence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the end of fiscal 2016, the Company had operations in 75 countries around the world and had approximately 84,000 partners (employees) employed outside the United States.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, international operations and distribution experience is important for our directors to have, especially as we continue to expand globally and develop new channels of distribution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless otherwise directed, the persons named in the proxy intend to vote all proxies FOR the election of the nominees, as listed below, each of whom has consented to serve as a director if elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If, at the time of the Annual Meeting, any nominee is unable or declines to serve as a director, the discretionary authority provided in the enclosed proxy will be exercised to vote for a substitute candidate designated by the board of directors, unless the board chooses to reduce its own size.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board of directors has no reason to believe that any of the nominees will be unable or will decline to serve if elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxies cannot be voted for more than fourteen persons since that is the total number of nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Domestic and international public policy experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that it is important for our directors to have domestic and international public policy experience in order to help us address significant public policy issues, adapt to different business and regulatory environments and facilitate our work with governments all over the world.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Digital and social media experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a consumer retail company, it is important for our directors to have digital and social media experience which can provide insight and perspective with respect to our marketing, sales and customer service functions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Set forth below is certain information furnished to us by the director nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There are no family relationships among any of our current directors or executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: None of the corporations or other organizations referenced in the biographical information below is a parent, subsidiary or other affiliate of Starbucks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Public company board experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors who have served on other public company boards can offer advice and perspective with respect to board dynamics and operations, relations between the board and Starbucks management and other matters, including corporate governance, executive compensation and oversight of strategic, operational compliance-related matters and relations with shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our directors should satisfy a number of qualifications, including demonstrated integrity, a record of personal accomplishments, a commitment to participation in board activities and other traits discussed below in Our Director Nominations Process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also endeavor to have a board representing a range of skills and depth of experience in areas that are relevant to and contribute to the boards oversight of the Companys global activities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following the biographical information for each director nominee, we describe the key experience, qualifications and skills the director nominees bring to the board that, for reasons discussed below, are important in light of Starbucks businesses and structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board considered these experiences, qualifications and skills and the nominees other qualifications in determining to recommend that they be nominated for election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Senior leadership experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that it is important for our directors to have served in senior leadership roles at other organizations, which demonstrates strong abilities to motivate and manage others, to identify and develop leadership qualities in others and to manage organizations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 8 Starbucks Corporation 2017 Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 1  ELECTION OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NOMINEES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on over 18 years in the U.S. Senate, Senator Bradley has a deep understanding of U.S. governmental and regulatory affairs, public policy and international relations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is able to provide the board of directors with unique insights into Starbucks strategy, operations and business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Senator Bradley also has extensive experience in the private sector, including in consulting, financial services and media and communications.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Senator Bradley brings to the board extensive experience as a director on the boards of other publicly traded companies, with knowledge in a number of important areas, including leadership and corporate governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Howard Schultz
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HOWARD SCHULTZ, 63, is the founder of Starbucks Corporation and currently serves as our chairman and chief executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As previously announced, Mr. Schultz will step down as chief executive officer and assume the role of executive chairman on April 3, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Schultz will continue to serve as chairman of the board in his new role.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Schultz has served as chairman of the board of directors since our inception in 1985, and in January 2008, he reassumed the role of president and chief executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He served as president until March 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From June 2000 to February 2005, Mr. Schultz also held the title of chief global strategist.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From November 1985 to June 2000, he served as chairman of the board and chief executive officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From November 1985 to June 1994, Mr. Schultz also served as president.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From January 1986 to July 1987, Mr. Schultz was the chairman of the board, chief executive officer and president of Il Giornale Coffee Company, a predecessor to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From September 1982 to December 1985, Mr. Schultz was the director of retail operations and marketing for Starbucks Coffee Company, a predecessor to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Schultz previously served on the Board of Directors of Groupon, Inc. through April 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rosalind Brewer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ROSALIND BREWER, 54, was nominated by the board as a Starbucks director in January 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Brewer has served as President and Chief Executive Officer of Sams Club, a membership-only retail warehouse club and a division of Walmart, since February 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Walmart recently announced Ms. Brewers retirement from Walmart effective February 1, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Previously, Ms. Brewer was Executive Vice President and President of Walmarts East Business Unit from February 2011 to January 2012; Executive Vice President and President of Walmart South from February 2010 to February 2011; Senior Vice President and Division President of the Southeast Operating Division from March 2007 to January 2010; and Regional General Manager, Georgia Operations, from 2006 to February 2007.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to joining Walmart, Ms. Brewer was President of Global Nonwovens Division for Kimberly-Clark Corporation, a global health and hygiene products company, from 2004 to 2006 and held various management positions at Kimberly-Clark Corporation from 1984 to 2006.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She serves on the Board of Directors for Lockheed Martin Corporation and is Chair of the Board of Trustees for Spelman College.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Brewer formerly served as a director of Molson Coors Brewing Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As the founder of Starbucks, Mr. Schultz has demonstrated a record of innovation, achievement and leadership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This experience provides the board of directors with a unique perspective into the operations and vision for Starbucks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Through his experience as the chairman and chief executive officer, Mr. Schultz is also able to provide the board of directors with insight and information regarding Starbucks strategy, operations and business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Mr. Schultz brings to the board more than 30 years of experience with Starbucks and extensive experience in the food and beverage industry, brand marketing and international distribution and operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Brewer brings to the board of directors extensive insight on large-scale operations and supply chain logistics based on her senior leadership positions as President and Chief Executive Officer of Sams Club and as Executive Vice President for Walmart, as well as extensive experience in consumer products and distribution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Brewer also brings to the board her vast experience in product development, product management, leadership, digital technology and innovation, and international operations and distribution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: William W. Bradley
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WILLIAM W. BRADLEY , 73, has been a Starbucks director since June 2003.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since 2000, Senator Bradley has been a Managing Director of Allen & Company LLC, an investment banking firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From 2001 until 2004, he acted as Chief Outside Advisor to McKinsey & Companys non-profit practice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2000, Senator Bradley was a candidate for the Democratic nomination for President of the United States.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He served as a Senior Advisor and Vice Chairman of the International Council of JP Morgan & Co. from 1997 through 1999.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During that time, Senator Bradley also worked as an essayist for CBS Evening News, and as a Visiting Professor at Stanford University, the University of Notre Dame and the University of Maryland.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Senator Bradley served in the U.S. Senate from 1979 until 1997, representing the State of New Jersey.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to serving in the U.S. Senate, he was an Olympic gold medalist in 1964, and from 1967 through 1977 he played professional basketball for the New York Knicks, during which time they won two world championships.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Senator Bradley previously served on the Boards of Directors of Seagate Technology, Willis Group Holdings Limited and QuinStreet, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Starbucks Corporation 2017 Proxy Statement 9
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mary N. Dillon
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mellody Hobson
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MARY N. DILLON, 55, has been a Starbucks director since January 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since July 2013, Ms. Dillon has served as Chief Executive Officer and a member of the Board of Directors of Ulta Salon, Cosmetics & Fragrance, Inc. (doing business as Ulta Beauty), a beauty products retailer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to joining Ulta, she served as President and Chief Executive Officer and a member of the Board of Directors of United States Cellular Corporation, a provider of wireless telecommunications services, beginning in June 2010.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to joining U.S. Cellular, Ms. Dillon served as Global Chief Marketing Officer and Executive Vice President of McDonalds Corporation from 2005 to 2010, where she led the companys worldwide marketing efforts and global brand strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to joining McDonalds, Ms. Dillon held several positions of increasing responsibility at PepsiCo Corporation, including as President of the Quaker Foods division from 2004 to 2005 and as Vice President of Marketing for Gatorade and Quaker Foods from 2002 to 2004.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Dillon previously served as a director of Target Corporation from 2007 to 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MELLODY HOBSON, 47, has been a Starbucks director since February 2005.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Hobson has served as the President and a Director of Ariel Investments, LLC, a Chicago-based investment management firm since 2000, and as the Chairman since 2006 and a Trustee since 1993 of the mutual funds it manages.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She previously served as Senior Vice President and Director of Marketing at Ariel Capital Management, Inc. from 1994 to 2000, and as Vice President of Marketing at Ariel Capital Management, Inc. from 1991 to 1994.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Hobson works with a variety of civic and professional institutions, including serving as a Governance Board Member of the Chicago Public Education Fund and as Chairman of After School Matters, which provides Chicago teens with high quality out-of-school time programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Hobson also serves on the Board of Directors of The Estee Lauder Companies, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, she is on the Board of Governors of the Investment Company Institute.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Hobson served on the Board of Directors of Groupon, Inc., through May 20, 2014, and on the Board of Directors of DreamWorks Animation SKG, Inc. until August 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As the president and a director of a large investment company, Ms. Hobson brings significant leadership, operational, investment and financial expertise to the board of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Hobsons experience as an on-air CBS news contributor and analyst on finance and the economy provides insight into media and communications and public relations considerations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Hobson also brings to the board of directors valuable knowledge of corporate governance and similar issues from her service on other publicly traded companies boards of directors as well as her service on the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) Investment Advisory Committee, which advises the SEC on matters of concern to investors in the securities markets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Ms. Hobson has brand marketing experience through her service on the Board of Directors of The Estee Lauder Companies and her past service on the DreamWorks Animation Board prior to its acquisition by Comcast Corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As CEO of a large publicly-traded company and with her prior executive leadership experience, Ms. Dillon is able to provide the board with top-level leadership perspective in organizational management and operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With 30 years of experience with large consumer-driven businesses, Ms. Dillon brings to the board her unique insights into the management of complex organizations in todays challenging retail environment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She also possesses valuable knowledge and expertise in brand marketing and strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Robert M. Gates
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ROBERT M. GATES, 73, has been a Starbucks director since May 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Secretary Gates served in numerous roles in the Executive Branch of the U.S. government for nearly half a century, culminating as Secretary of Defense from December 2006 to June 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In October 2013, Secretary Gates was elected to the National Executive Board of the Boy Scouts of America.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In May 2014, he was named its National President for a two-year term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In September 2011, Secretary Gates was named Chancellor of the College of William & Mary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From August 2002 to December 2006, he served as President of Texas A&M University.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Secretary Gates has previously been a member of the Board of Directors of several companies, including Brinker International, Inc., NACCO Industries, Inc., Parker Drilling Company and the Board of Independent Trustees of the Fidelity Funds.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Kevin R. Johnson
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: KEVIN R. JOHNSON, 56, has served as our president and chief operating officer since March 2015 and has been a Starbucks director since March 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As previously announced, Mr. Johnson will assume the role of president and chief executive officer on April 3, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Johnson served as Chief Executive Officer of Juniper Networks, Inc., a leading provider of high-performance networking products and services, from September 2008 to December 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He also served on the Board of Directors of Juniper Networks from September 2008 through February 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to joining Juniper Networks, Mr. Johnson served as President, Platforms and Services Division for Microsoft Corporation, a worldwide provider of software, services and solutions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Johnson was a member of Microsofts Senior Leadership Team and held a number of senior executive positions over the course of his 16 years at Microsoft.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to joining Microsoft in 1992, Mr. Johnson worked in International Business Machine Corp.s systems integration and consulting business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Secretary Gates extensive career in various leadership roles in the executive branch of government provides the board of directors with invaluable perspective on domestic and international issues and risks affecting Starbucks business throughout the world.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board of directors also benefits from his leadership experience at large institutions that deal with problem solving in which many, often conflicting, public and private cultural, political, economic and other interests are involved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, his experience as a member of the board of directors of several public companies, including his roles as the chair of audit committees, strengthens the depth of corporate governance and risk assessment knowledge of the board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 10 Starbucks Corporation 2017 Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 1  ELECTION OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Johnson has extensive experience in the technology industry and is able to provide the board of directors with his unique insights into platforms for global integration of information systems as well as the use of technology in our brand marketing and media and communications efforts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Through his various senior leadership positions, including his experience as Chief Executive Officer of Juniper Networks and extensive senior executive experience with a large, multinational company, Mr. Johnson also has experience with the challenges inherent in managing a complex organization, leading global businesses focused on both consumer and business needs and utilizing technology to drive business productivity and experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Nadella brings to the board of directors extensive experience in the technology industry and an understanding of how technology will be used and experienced around the world.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He also provides the board with invaluable insight as we continue our focus on innovative ways to use technology to elevate our brand and grow our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Nadella also brings insight and knowledge in international operations and distribution gained from his service as CEO and other senior leadership positions at one of the worlds largest public technology companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Joshua Cooper Ramo
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: JOSHUA COOPER RAMO, 48, has been a Starbucks director since May 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since July 2015, Mr. Ramo has served as Co-Chief Executive Officer and Vice Chairman of Kissinger Associates, an advisory firm where he has served as Vice Chairman since 2011 and been employed since 2005.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He was previously the Managing Partner for the Office of John L. Thornton, a corporate advisory specialist and an advisor to Goldman Sachs, from 2003 to 2005.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Ramo spent his early career as a journalist, most recently with Time Magazine, from 1996 to 2003 serving as Senior Editor and Foreign Editor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is a leading China scholar and has written several papers on Chinas development that have been distributed in China and abroad.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2008, Mr. Ramo served as China Analyst for NBC during the Summer Olympics in Beijing.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is the author of two New York Times best-selling books, The Age of the Unthinkable (2009) and The Seventh Sense (2016).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Ramo has been a term member of the Council on Foreign Relations, Asia 21 Leaders Program, World Economic Forums Young Global Leaders and Global Leaders for Tomorrow, and co-founder of the U.S.-China Young Leaders Forum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SHAREHOLDER ENGAGEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a long-standing history of actively engaging with our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that strong corporate governance should include year-round engagement with our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a long-standing, robust shareholder outreach program led by a cross-functional team including partners from our Investor Relations, Total Rewards, Law & Corporate Affairs and Global Responsibility departments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Through this outreach, we solicit feedback on our executive compensation program, corporate governance and disclosure practices and respond to questions regarding our Global Responsibility programs and goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We share feedback we receive with our Compensation Committee and board of directors as demonstrated below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Winter/Spring Publish Annual Report and proxy  statement Active outreach with top investors to  discuss important items to be considered at  Annual Meeting of Shareholders Annual Meeting of Shareholders Summer Review results from our most recent Annual  Meeting Share investor feedback with Compensation Committee and board of directors Evaluate proxy season trends, corporate  governance best practices, regulatory  developments and our current practices Fall Active outreach with top investors to understand their priorities for corporate governance and  executive compensation Share investor feedback with Compensation Committee and board of directors Board of directors considers investor  feedback received throughout the year
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Feedback on Proxy Access
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of our normal outreach, during 2016 we reached out to our top shareholders and had conversations with corporate governance contacts representing over 30% of our shares outstanding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, our senior management team, including our chairman and ceo, our president and coo, and our cfo, regularly engage in meaningful dialogue with our shareholders through our quarterly earnings calls and other channels for communication.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At our 2016 Annual Meeting, a shareholder proposal to adopt a proxy access bylaw was supported by a majority of the shares that voted on the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In our subsequent discussions with shareholders; who collectively held more than 30% of our shares outstanding regarding the form of proxy access to be adopted, we sought and received the following feedback:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While shareholders were not unanimous in their view, they generally supported the concept of proxy access;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In recent years, shareholder feedback has also influenced certain of our compensation design and philosophy changes, including most recently minimizing the use of special equity grants, and in prior years replacing EPS as a performance measure under our EMBP with adjusted net revenue (recognizing that EPS remains a performance measure under our performance RSUs), and lengthening the performance period under our performance RSU design from one year to two years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder views on specific terms under which proxy access should be adopted varied, but most shareholders we spoke with supported the core terms that we adopted (3% ownership threshold for 3 years, a nomination right of the greater of 2 or 20% of the board and a limit of 20 shareholders who may aggregate their holdings to meet the 3% ownership threshold); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 14 Starbucks Corporation 2017 Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Most shareholders also generally supported the secondary proxy access bylaw terms and limitations that were discussed and that our board ultimately adopted, including counting multiple investment funds under common management as one shareholder, counting shares on loan toward satisfying the ownership threshold if the shareholder has the right to recall the shares within five business days notice and prohibiting third party compensation for director services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: outreach summarized above, our board amended our Bylaws in September of 2016 to implement proxy access.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RISK OVERSIGHT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The board of directors has overall responsibility for risk oversight, including, as part of regular board and committee meetings, general oversight of executives management of risks relevant to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A fundamental part of risk oversight is not only understanding the material risks a company faces and the steps management is taking to manage those risks, but also understanding what level of risk is appropriate for the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The involvement of the board of directors in reviewing Starbucks business strategy is an integral aspect of the boards assessment of managements tolerance for risk and also its determination of what constitutes an appropriate level of risk for the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Risk Management Committee is focused on risks facing the Company, including strategic risks, market risks, internal control risks and operational risks and provides information to the Audit Committee at its regularly scheduled meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee also receives regular reports from management including our chief ethics and compliance officer, vice president and controller and vice president of Internal Audit on risks facing the Company at its regularly scheduled meetings and other reports as requested by the Audit Committee from time to time.

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee is responsible for reviewing and overseeing the management of any potential material risks related to Starbucks compensation policies and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FISCAL 2016 COMPENSATION PROGRAM FOR NON-EMPLOYEE DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For fiscal 2016, the annual compensation program for non-employee directors provided for a total of $260,000 per year comprised of one or more of the following (as selected by the director each year):
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) cash (up to 50%);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) stock options; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) time-based restricted stock units (RSUs).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The $260,000 total annual compensation amount was an increase from the $240,000 total annual compensation amount for fiscal 2015 and the first increase since 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The design of the program remains the same.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: New non-employee directors are entitled to payment of a pro-rated portion of the annual non-employee director compensation based on the number of days remaining in the fiscal year from the date the director joins the board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such compensation may be in the form of stock options, time-based RSUs or a combination thereof (as selected by the director).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options have an exercise price equal to the closing market price of our common stock on the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual stock option and RSU grants vest one year after the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options and RSUs granted to non-employee directors generally cease vesting as of the date he or she no longer serves on the board of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, unvested stock options and unvested RSUs will vest in full upon a non-employee directors death, disability or retirement (defined as ceasing to be a director pursuant
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) to election by the Companys shareholders,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) by voluntary resignation with the approval of the boards chair, after attaining age 55 and at least six years of continuous board service, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) due to reaching mandatory retirement age immediately before the Companys annual meeting of shareholders during the calendar year in which he or she attains age 75) or upon a change in control of Starbucks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Five of the boards ten current non-employee directors meet the retirement criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When the Nominating/Governance Committee considered and ultimately recommended the fiscal 2016 non-employee director compensation, the Nominating/Governance Committee reviewed competitive data prepared by Towers Watson for the same peer group used to benchmark executive compensation for fiscal 2015 (disclosed in the proxy statement for the 2016 Annual Meeting of Shareholders).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The level of non-employee director total compensation for fiscal 2016 was in the 75th percentile among peer companies and the board believed that the level was appropriate to attract and retain top board candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Schultz and Mr. Johnson do not participate in the compensation program for non-employee directors, but rather are compensated as executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Schultz will continue to be compensated as an executive officer upon his transition to the role of executive chairman on April 3, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Information on compensation paid to Mr. Schultz and Mr. Johnson in fiscal 2016 is described in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis section of this proxy statement.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Stock Ownership Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our long-standing stock ownership guidelines for non-employee directors require our directors to own at least $480,000 in Company stock to align the interests of our non-employee directors to those of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors appointed or elected after June 5, 2012 have four years from their date of appointment or election to meet the guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options and unvested RSUs do not count toward meeting the guidelines, but deferred stock units resulting from deferrals under the deferred compensation plans for directors described above do count toward meeting the guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director is expected to continue to meet the ownership requirement for as long as he or she serves on our board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except for Ms. Dillon, who joined the board in January 2016, all current non-employee directors have met these guidelines as of the date of this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal 2011, the board adopted a Deferred Compensation Plan for Non-Employee Directors under which non-employee directors may, for any fiscal year starting in fiscal 2012, irrevocably elect to defer receipt of shares of common stock the director would have received upon vesting of restricted stock units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of the plan is to enhance the Companys ability to attract and retain non-employee directors with training, experience and ability who will promote the interests of the Company and to directly align the interests of such non-employee directors with the interests of the Companys shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to 2006, non-employee directors could defer all or a portion of their compensation in the form of unfunded deferred stock units under the Directors Deferred Compensation Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 2  ADVISORY RESOLUTION TO APPROVE OUR EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are asking shareholders to approve an advisory resolution (commonly referred to as a say-on-pay resolution) on the Companys executive compensation as reported in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: as amended, (the Exchange Act) and as a matter of good corporate governance, we are asking shareholders to approve the following advisory resolution at the Annual Meeting of Shareholders:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We urge shareholders to read the Compensation Discussion and Analysis section of this proxy statement, which describes how our executive compensation policies and procedures operate and are designed to achieve our compensation objectives, as well as the Summary Compensation Table and other related compensation tables and narrative, which provide detailed information on the compensation of our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee and the board of directors believe that the policies and procedures articulated in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis are effective in achieving our goals and that the compensation of our named executive officers reported in this proxy statement has contributed to the Companys recent and long-term success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the shareholders of Starbucks Corporation (the Company) approve, on an advisory basis, the compensation of the Companys named executive officers disclosed in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the Summary Compensation Table and the related compensation tables, notes and narrative in the Proxy Statement for the Companys Annual Meeting of Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This advisory say-on-pay resolution is non-binding on the board of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although non-binding, the board and the Compensation Committee will review and consider the voting results when making future decisions regarding our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless the board modifies its policy on the frequency of future say-on-pay advisory votes, the next say-on-pay advisory vote will be held at the 2018 Annual Meeting of Shareholders.

sentences.text: The board has adopted a policy providing for an annual say-on-pay advisory vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with this policy and Section 14A of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934,

sentences.text: FINANCIAL HIGHLIGHTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Starbucks record fiscal 2016 results in the face of ongoing economic, consumer and geopolitical headwinds demonstrate the power, relevance and resilience of the Starbucks business and brand.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company delivered record results in its 53-week fiscal year 2016, increasing global comparable store sales by 5% driven by a 4% increase in ticket and a 1% increase in traffic, consolidated net revenue grew 11% to $21.3 billion and consolidated operating income grew by 16% to $4.2 billion year over year; 3-year cumulative total shareholder return (TSR) was 46%.

sentences.text: In addition, we returned $3.2 billion to shareholders in the form of share repurchases and cash dividend payments in fiscal 2016.

sentences.text: Pay for Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program reflects a strong pay-for-performance alignment tied with overall company and business-unit performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In line with our emphasis on pay-for-performance and our performance relative to our peers, compensation awarded to our NEOs for fiscal 2016 reflected Starbucks record financial results.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term Incentive Awards:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Schultz, Mr. Johnson and Mr. Maw all earned EMBP awards at 85% of target, reflecting our performance against challenging overall Company goals based on adjusted operating income, adjusted net revenue and ROIC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our two group presidents earned EMBP awards primarily reflecting the performance of their businesses against these goals: John Culver, group president, Starbucks Global Retail, earned an EMBP award of 132% of target, based primarily on the performance of the Channel Development and China/Asia Pacific segments, which he led during fiscal 2016; and Clifford Burrows, group president, Siren Retail, earned an EMBP award of 76% of target, based primarily on the performance of the Americas segment which he led during fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Long-Term Incentive Awards are granted in the form of: (1) performance RSUs, where the number of shares earned is dependent on the achievement of future EPS and ROIC goals; and (2) stock options where the realizable value is dependent on future share price appreciation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Investing in Our Partners
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that investing in our partners results in increased engagement, satisfaction and retention, which ultimately leads to an elevated Starbucks Experience for our customers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Below is a summary of our broad-based benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: College Achievement Plan: The Starbucks College Achievement Plan was launched in fiscal 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It provides eligible partners in the U.S. with the opportunity to earn a bachelors degree online from Arizona State University with full tuition coverage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, our military service member and veteran partners can extend an additional Starbucks College Achievement Plan benefit to their spouse, domestic partner, or child.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the end of fiscal 2016, more than 6,100 partners were participating in the plan, including 229 graduates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broad-Based Equity Program (Bean Stock): A long-term incentive grant of time-based RSUs was made in November 2016 to approximately 162,000 eligible non-executive partners in 22 markets around the world, including qualified part-time partners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We refer to this broad-based equity program as our Bean Stock program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Bean Stock participants include those partners who work in our stores and serve our customers directly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal 2016, Bean Stock participants realized approximately $221.6 million in pre-tax gains from previously-granted Bean Stock awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Enhancing the Partner Experience: In addition to our long-time benefits of a pound of coffee each week and beverages while on work breaks, U.S. store partners can choose one food item, per shift, from the pastry or ready-to-eat case.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: U.S. Partners may also sign up for a Spotify Premium Account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Future Roast 401(k) Starbucks Match: Starbucks matches 100% of the first 5% of eligible compensation deferred.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Starbucks Match is immediately 100% vested and is contributed to each participants 401(k) account each pay period along with their contributions.

sentences.text: Overview of Annual Long-Term Incentive Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We grant our executives long-term performance-based compensation in the form of stock options and performance RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes stock options and performance RSUs incentivize executives to drive long-term company performance, thereby aligning our executives interests with the long-term interests of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our current annual grant program, 60% of the total annual long-term incentive award value is delivered in performance RSUs and 40% in stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The table below reflects the value of annual long-term incentive awards approved by the Committee for each of the last two fiscal years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We determined the number of RSUs to be delivered by dividing 60% of the value approved by the Committee by the closing price of our stock on the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For options, we divided 40% of the value by a closing price multiplier.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This multiplier was calculated by multiplying the closing price of our common stock on the grant date by a Black-Scholes factor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because the value approved by the Committee is approved in advance of the awards being granted and may use different assumptions than are applied to the awards for accounting purposes, the value of awards approved by the Committee may be different than the grant date fair value of equity awards as disclosed in the Summary Compensation Table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Both types of equity awards we grant as part of our long-term incentive compensation program are performance-based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options provide value only if our stock price increases over time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance RSUs are earned only to the extent pre-established performance goals are met and, if earned, are subject to additional time-based vesting requirements.

sentences.text: Change-in-Control Arrangements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not provide any special change-in-control benefits to executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our only change-in-control arrangement, which applies to all partners with equity compensation awards, is double-trigger accelerated vesting of equity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This means that under our equity plan, unvested stock options and unvested restricted stock units will accelerate vesting if
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) there is a change in control and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) either
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) stock options and RSUs are assumed or substituted with equivalent stock options or restricted stock units of the surviving company and the partner is terminated or resigns for good reason within one year after the change in control or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) stock options or RSUs are not assumed or substituted with stock options or RSUs of the surviving company, in which case they vest immediately upon a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe it is appropriate to provide double-trigger accelerated equity vesting because it aligns executives interests with the interests of shareholders without providing an undue benefit to executives who continue to be employed following a change-in control transaction.

sentences.text: Starbucks Insider Trading Policy prohibits Starbucks partners from engaging in hedging transactions designed to offset decreases in the market value of Starbucks securities, including certain forms of hedging and monetization transactions, such as zero-cost collars and prepaid variable forward contracts.

sentences.text: Starbucks Clawback policy allows the Company to seek reimbursement with respect to incentive compensation paid or awarded to executive officers (as designated by the board) where:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the payment of a bonus or equity award (or the vesting of such award) was predicated upon the achievement of financial results that were the product of fraudulent activity or that were subsequently the subject of a material negative restatement; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) a lower or no bonus payment or equity award would have been made to executive officers (or lesser or no vesting would have occurred with respect to such award) based on the restated financial results (the financial results that would have pertained absent such fraudulent activity).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy became effective, with respect to equity awards, beginning with awards granted in fiscal 2010 and, with respect to annual incentive bonuses, beginning with bonuses earned for fiscal 2010.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Insider Trading Policy prohibits Starbucks partners from holding Starbucks stock in a margin account or pledging Starbucks stock as collateral for a loan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There is a limited exception to our policy prohibiting the pledging of Starbucks stock as collateral for a loan (not including margin debt, for which there is no exception to the prohibition).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to be granted an exception, the partner must clearly demonstrate the financial capacity to repay the loan without resorting to the pledged securities and must request and receive approval from the general counsel of Starbucks prior to the documentation of the proposed pledge.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the date of this proxy statement, other than Mr. Schultz, there are no executive officers or directors who have Starbucks securities pledged as collateral for a loan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Schultz has 1,400,000 of his Starbucks shares pledged to secure a line of credit.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee operates the EMBP under a shareholder-approved plan with the goal of satisfying the conditions to obtain deductibility of the annual bonus under Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We generally intend annual incentive bonuses and long-term incentive awards (stock options and performance-based RSUs) to be eligible to qualify as tax-deductible to Starbucks, but we have the flexibility to pay non-deductible compensation when necessary to achieve our executive compensation objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, because there are uncertainties as to the application of regulations under Section 162(m), as with most tax matters, it is possible that our efforts to satisfy the conditions of Section 162(m) may be challenged or disallowed.

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 3  ADVISORY VOTE ON THE FREQUENCY OF FUTURE ADVISORY VOTES ON EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to Section 14A of the Exchange Act, we are asking shareholders to vote on whether future advisory votes on executive compensation of the nature reflected in Proposal Number 2 above should occur every year, every two years or every three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The company has had annual votes starting with the 2012 annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: annual meeting of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that an annual advisory vote on executive compensation is consistent with our practice of seeking input and engaging in dialogue with our shareholders on corporate governance matters (including the Companys practice of having all directors elected annually and annually providing shareholders the opportunity to ratify the Audit Committees selection of independent auditors) and our executive compensation philosophy, policies and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Companys executive compensation programs are designed to promote a long-term connection between pay and performance, the board recognizes that executive compensation disclosures are made annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Holding an annual advisory vote on executive compensation provides the Company with more direct and immediate feedback on our compensation disclosures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, shareholders should note that because the advisory vote on executive compensation occurs well after the beginning of the compensation year, and because the different elements of our executive compensation programs are designed to operate in an integrated manner and to complement one another, in many cases it may not be appropriate or feasible to change our executive compensation programs in consideration of any one years advisory vote on executive compensation by the time of the following years
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This advisory vote on the frequency of future advisory votes on executive compensation is non-binding on the board of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders will be able to specify one of four choices for this proposal on the proxy card: one year, two years, three years or abstain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders are not voting to approve or disapprove the boards recommendation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although non-binding, the board and the Compensation Committee will carefully review the voting results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding the boards recommendation and the outcome of the shareholder vote, the board may in the future decide to conduct advisory votes on a more or less frequent basis and may vary its practice based on factors such as discussions with shareholders and the adoptions of material changes to compensation programs.

sentences.text: Our proxy access bylaw permits a shareholder, or a group of up to 20 shareholders, owning at least three percent of the Companys outstanding shares of common stock continuously for at least three years, to nominate and include in our annual meeting proxy materials director nominees constituting up to 20% of the board (but not less than two nominees), subject to the requirements specified in our bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our proxy access bylaw provides that a candidate who does not receive at least 25% of the shares present and entitled to vote in the election of directors may not be nominated as a proxy access candidate for the following two years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This provision is designed solely to prevent shareholders from abusing the proxy access process and forcing the Company to incur the administrative burden and expense associated with responding to proxy access for candidates whom shareholders did not meaningfully support.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company adopted proxy access following our shareholders vote supporting proxy access at the 2016 annual meeting of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proxy access bylaw terms we adopted were informed by our outreach discussions with many of our top shareholders, who collectively represented over 30% of the total shares outstanding, as to proxy access parameters they believed were appropriate for the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also analyzed the terms adopted by other Fortune 500 companies and input from governance experts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After taking into consideration the views of our shareholders and the analysis described above, we adopted what we believe is an appropriate and effective proxy access framework that is consistent with market practice and provides meaningful proxy access rights to shareholders, while balancing the need to protect the interests of all of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company believes that the changes advocated by the proponent are not necessary to provide for an appropriate and meaningful proxy access process and may be potentially disruptive to the effective functioning of our board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to proxy access, Starbucks has a number of corporate governance measures in place that further support the accountability of the board to our shareholders, including (1) a robust shareholder engagement program through which we connect with top shareholders regularly to discuss and obtain their views on corporate governance matters and other issues important to all shareholders, including proxy access, (2) an annual election of all directors, (3) majority voting in the election of directors, and (4) the ability of shareholders owning ten percent of our stock to have the board call a special meeting of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our proxy access bylaw allows eligible shareholders to nominate up to the greater of two nominees or 20% of the board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This accomplishes the proxy access objective of providing shareholders the opportunity to pursue meaningful representation on the board for qualified individuals endorsed by a majority of shareholders.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our recently adopted proxy access bylaw is consistent with market practice and strikes the appropriate balance between providing a useful proxy access process and mitigating potential misuse.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that the changes advocated by the proponent are unnecessary and could be detrimental to shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, we do not believe it is in the best interests of the Company and its shareholders to change our proxy access bylaw as outlined in the proposal.
